cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the Louisiana coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to southwest Louisiana coast (near Cameron–Vermilion Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect yet – watches expected to be issued Wednesday for portions of the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward to the Mississippi–Alabama coastline, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) increasingly likely Friday with a 26 % chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and a 14 % chance of hurricane-force gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft or higher surge in and east of the Mississippi River delta depending on exact track; official storm-surge watches expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches possible across southeast Louisiana, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and swell, possible tornadoes in outer rain bands, and temporary river/levee stresses along the Mississippi River near the port
